tool.name: Find Sequence Liabilities
tool.command: #if $input.multiple: python $__tool_directory__/sequence-liabilities.py multiple --input-fasta $input.input_fasta --liability-patterns #for $liability in $liabilities: "'$liability.name'=$liability.patterns" #end for --format $format --output-tsv $output_tsv; #else: python $__tool_directory__/sequence-liabilities.py single --input-sequence $input.input_sequence --liability-patterns #for $liability in $liabilities: "'$liability.name'=$liability.patterns" #end for --format $format --output-tsv $output_tsv; #end if ]

param.name: multiple
param.label: Submit multiple sequences
param.help: Whether to submit more than one sequence for liability detection.

param.label: Input FASTA
param.help: FASTA file with sequences to find sequence liabilities in.

param.label: Input Sequence
param.help: Amino acid sequence to find sequence liabilities in.

param.label: Format
param.help: What format to return results in
param.option: Each liability as a single row
Each sequence as a single row
An alignment of each sequence and its liabilities

param.name: patterns
param.label: Pattenrs
param.help: A comma-separated list of regular expressions to search for liabilities with, i.e. 'N[^P]S,N[^P]T'.

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark.
**What it does**
This tool takes one or more amino acid sequences and finds any specified liabilities matching regular expressions.
